com.gemalto.idp.mobile.core

Class IdpCore

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gemalto.idp.mobile.core.IdpCore

  • public abstract class IdpCore
extends java.lang.Object
    IdpCore is the entry-point of the SDK Core. IdpCore takes the configurations needed for different modules and provides shared SDK functionalities.
    Since:
    4.0

    • Method Detail

      • preLoad

        public static void preLoad()
        Deprecated. This method will be removed in future major release, and has no effect calling it since 5.0.
        Preload native libraries, for security consideration, Ezio SDK will enforce the security related native libraries to be loaded before any other call into the SDK. This API call is optional. If this API is not invoked separately, the native libraries will be loaded synchrounously in IdpCore.configure(...) which would take add 100ms to 500ms to the IdpCore.configure(...) call depending on the device specification. It is recommended invoke the preLoad() in your application entry point:
        • Application class onCreate()
        • onCreate of The first Activity that is to be launched.
        System.setProperty("java.io.tmpdir", getDir("files", Context.MODE_PRIVATE).getPath()); IdpCore.preLoad(); First option is preferred as it is invoked before any Activity/Service is started.
        Since:
        4.4

      • configure

        public static IdpCore configure(IdpConfiguration... config)
        Configure IdpCore. Must be called before using any other modules. Configuration can only be called once.
        Parameters:
        config - required for using OobModule & OtpModule
        Returns:
        IdpCore
        Since:
        4.0

      • configure

        public static IdpCore configure(boolean deviceSourceBinding,
                                IdpConfiguration... config)
        Configure IdpCore. Must be called before using any other modules. Configuration can only be called once.
        Parameters:
        deviceSourceBinding - device binding to enable or disable DEVICE fingerprint source. Enabling this flag is equivalent to including 'DEVICE' in the Device Fingerprint Source configuration in 2.X.
        config - required for using OobModule & OtpModule
        Returns:
        IdpCore
        Since:
        4.4

      • configure

        public static IdpCore configure(byte[] activationCode,
                                IdpConfiguration... config)
        Configure IdpCore. Must be called before using any other modules. Configuration can only be called once.
        Parameters:
        activationCode - activation code to activate specific features. To be requested from Gemalto.
        config - required for using OobModule & OtpModule
        Returns:
        IdpCore
        Since:
        4.0

      • configure

        public static IdpCore configure(boolean deviceSourceBinding,
                                byte[] activationCode,
                                IdpConfiguration... config)
        Configure IdpCore. Must be called before using any other modules. Configuration can only be called once.
        Parameters:
        deviceSourceBinding - device binding to enable or disable DEVICE fingerprint source. Enabling this flag is equivalent to including 'DEVICE' in the Device Fingerprint Source configuration in 2.X.
        activationCode - activation code to activate specific features. To be requested from Gemalto.
        config - required for using OobModule & OtpModule
        Returns:
        IdpCore
        Since:
        4.4

      • getInstance

        public static IdpCore getInstance()
        Get IdpCore instance. Throws IllegalStateException if not configured.
        Returns:
        IdpCore instance.
        Since:
        4.0

      • getPasswordManager

        public abstract PasswordManager getPasswordManager()
        Get passwordManager. which is used to unlock secrets used by different modules.

      • reset

        public static void reset()
        Reset the core instance so that Core can be configured again with different settings.
        Since:
        4.9.0

      • updateConfigurations

        public static void updateConfigurations(IdpConfiguration... configs)
        Update Configuration. This will replace existing one (if any) and add new one (if it does not exist previously). However, it will not delete existing one if configs parameter does not contains some of existing one
        Parameters:
        configs - list of configuration parameters. It does not need to contains all existing configurations
        Since:
        5.3.0
